citation.title: Pliocene-Pleistocene stack of globally distributed benthic stable oxygen isotope records

wikipedia.title: Temperature record
wikipedia.summary: The temperature record shows the fluctuations of the temperature of the atmosphere and the oceans through various spans of time.

wikipedia.title: Illinoian (stage)
wikipedia.summary: The Illinoian Stage is the name used by Quaternary geologists in North America to designate the period of geologic time of ~191,000—130,000 years ago, a period of ~ during the middle Pleistocene when sediments comprising the Illinoian Glacial Lobe were dep

wikipedia.title: List of Quaternary volcanic eruptions
wikipedia.summary: This article is a list of volcanic eruptions of approximately magnitude 6 or more on the Volcanic Explosivity Index (VEI) or equivalent sulfur dioxide emission during the Holocene, and Pleistocene eruptions of the Decade Volcanoes (Avachinsky-Koryaksky, Ka

wikipedia.title: Geologic temperature record
wikipedia.summary: The Geologic temperature record are changes in Earth's environment as determined from geologic evidence on multi-million to billion (109) year time scales.

wikipedia.title: Pastonian Stage
wikipedia.summary: The Pastonian interglacial, now called the Pastonian Stage (from Paston, Norfolk), is the name for an early or middle Pleistocene stage used in the British Isles.

wikipedia.title: Δ18O
wikipedia.summary: In geochemistry, paleoclimatology and paleoceanography δ18O or delta-O-18 is a measure of the ratio of stable isotopes 18O:16O (oxygen-18:oxygen-16).
